thread.title: Celine Dion adds new 2016 performances to her residency at The Colosseum
thread.title_full: Celine Dion adds new 2016 performances to her residency at The Colosseum

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Celine Dion adds new 2016 performances to her residency at The Colosseum
text:
Celine Dion adds new 2016 performances to her residency at The Colosseum   
Oct 05, 2015 eTN   
LAS VEGAS, NV - Still glowing from the reaction of her recent return to The Colosseum at Caesars Palace, Celine Dion has announced 23 more performances of her critically-acclaimed Las Vegas residency show, Celine. 
After a year hiatus from the stage, the legendary singer made her anticipated return to The Colosseum at Caesars Palace on Aug. 27 with an updated residency show that is being embraced by fans and media and receiving rave reviews. Since her return, Celine will have performed 18 consecutive sold-out shows to over 75,000 people. 
Additional 23 performances are: 
Feb.: 23, 24, 26, 27 Mar.: 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11, 12 May: 17, 18, 20, 21, 24, 27, 28, 31 June: 1, 3, 4 
Performance dates previously announced and on sale are: 
2015 
Oct.: 6, 7, 9, 10 SOLD OUT Nov.: 3, 4, 7, 8, 10, 11, 13, 14, 17, 18, 20, 21 Dec.: 30, 31 
2016 
Jan.: 2, 6, 9, 10, 12, 13, 16, 17 
Celine at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace is a glamorous show directed by legendary Grammy Awards producer Ken Ehrlich and presented by AEG Live and Caesars Entertainment. Celine's updated show includes her biggest hits mixed with timeless hits by iconic artists that celebrate all generations and genres of music ranging from Elvis to the Bee Gees, Queen and Prince. The show features a full orchestra and band and is set to a visually stunning presentation designed exclusively for the 4,300-seat state-of-the-art venue. 
One of the most immediately recognized, and successful performers in pop music history, Celine Dion has sold almost 250 million albums during her over 30-year career. She has earned five Grammy Awards, two Academy Awards, seven American Music Awards, 20 Juno Awards (Canada) and an astonishing 40 Felix Award (Quebec). In 2004, Celine received the Diamond award at the World Music Awards recognizing her status as the best-selling female artist of all time. In 2007 she was honored with the Legend Award at World Music Awards in recognition of her global success and outstanding contribution to the music industry.
